title: The small launch industry is brutal—yes, even more than you thought
summary: "He must be out of money by now, surely?"

title: NASA's Curiosity Views First 'Sun Rays' on Mars
summary: The veteran rover captured a dazzling sunset at the start of a new cloud-imaging campaign.

title: JAXA and Mitsubishi ready for second attempt at H3 rocket debut
summary: JAXA and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries are readying for a second attempt to debut the H3 launch vehicle at 01:37 UTC Tuesday. For its maiden flight, the rocket will launch the ALOS-3 optical satellite into a 669-kilometer Sun-synchronous orbit (SSO) from the Tanegashima Space Center in Japan.

title: NASA shifts focus of suborbital crew program
summary: A NASA program originally intended to fly astronauts on commercial suborbital vehicles has evolved into a broader effort to enable flights by agency personnel and supporting the nascent industry.

title: The gold rush for the next round of military launch contracts has started
summary: Everything you've ever wanted to know about military launch procurement.
